abstract.text: Fills a passed-in buffer with a sequence of glyphs.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The range of glyphs to fill in.
On output, the sequence of glyphs in the given glyph range.
If not
, on output, the glyph properties corresponding to the filled-in glyphs.
If not

, on output, the indexes of the original characters corresponding to the given glyph range. Note that a glyph at index 1 is not necessarily mapped to the character at index 1, since a glyph may be for a ligature or accent.
If not

, on output, the direction of each glyph for bidirectional text. The values range from 0 to 61 as defined by Unicode Standard Annex #9. An even value means the glyph goes left-to-right, and an odd value means the glyph goes right-to-left.
The number of glyphs returned in

or else point to sufficient memory to hold

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An object that coordinates the layout and display of text characters.
Returns the glyph at the specified index.
Returns the glyph at the specified index along with information about whether the glyph index is valid.
Returns the index in the text storage for the first character of the specified glyph.
Fills a passed-in buffer with a sequence of glyphs.
Returns the index of the first glyph of the character at the specified index.
Indicates whether the specified index refers to a valid glyph.
The number of glyphs in the layout manager.
Returns the glyph property of the glyph at the specified index.
Stores the initial glyphs and glyph properties for a character range.
A Swift-only concrete structure that backs the range type alias.
An index into the internal glyph table of a font.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
